title: 12 simple hacks that will transform your tiny balcony into a cozy corner
text:
12 simple hacks that will transform your tiny balcony into a cozy corner 12 simple hacks that will transform your tiny balcony into a cozy corner Like this story, share it with millions of investors on M3 12 simple hacks that will transform your tiny balcony into a cozy corner 12 simple hacks that will transform your tiny balcony into a cozy corner Post your opinion here 
W ith the way properties are priced these days, it doesn’t come as a surprise to see families settling down into smaller living spaces. And with a number of multistorey buildings dotting cities, home buyers today are deprived of a cozy corner. However, if you do have a tiny balcony, here are a few genius ways you could convert your tiny outdoor space into a cozy getaway spot. 
Convert wooden crates into low lying seats. Line the corner of the balcony grill with a few crates and throw some foam rug on them and there you have a quiet corner perfect for those morning coffeesInstead of spending a bomb to buy a rustic coffee table, paint a few wooden boxes and flip them towards the side and viola you have your own rustic side tableIf you spend most of your time in the balcony, it’s important to give it a makeover and there’s nothing better for that than redoing the flooring. Cover the plain old concrete floor with some wooden tiles or stencils tiles.Covering the balcony with a water based polyurethane rug too will work wondersWant a lawn and can’t afford one? Well line your balcony floor with artificial grass. Now walk over the grass and feel your backyard inside your house!Placing railing plant pots are ideal for all those who love hosting outdoor parties. These pots not only cover up the steel railing, but it also provides a perfect backdrop that is ideal for brunch partiesAdding quick foldable tables converts the balcony into a cozy spot that is perfect for quick romantic dinnersIf you want to stop the peeping toms from invading your privacy then hang outdoor curtains. Curtains not only add an element of colour to your balcony but they also help you in providing you privacyIf you are one of those who have a tiny balcony, bring that space into your room by lining the outdoor floor with a few cushions and rugs. So for all those who don’t have money to invest in a sofa, this could be your ideal seating areaHave those old rustic wooden chairs? Don’t throw them away, rather arrange them in your balcony along with a few potted plants and you have your own bookworm’s cornerPlacing a few hammocks across the balcony too will help you create an informal settingLining the balcony roof with a few lanterns and mini lights help in creating an ideal environment perfect for romantic dinnerNidhi C Thacker for IndiaProperty.com
